column5: Got a double barrel.. one with bird shot.. one with slugs??  That Doe balanced like that for over 5 minutes eating the buds off the Sumac !!
What's with these guys? In the last week I've see close to 15 at about 7:30 am at Islington north of Rutherford and in the valley just below Hwy 7 . . .  Don't they know what time it is?
Just a normal day in the yard for us Ketch!
BUGGER OFF you bugger.LOL  Thanks Wayne for the pics.Put the third pic on my screen.
Got a double barrel.. one with bird shot.. one with slugs??   Lew, did you see what Wayne just said??
I don't know if that would help him, with his luck he'd probably fire the slug at the turkey, the bird shot at the deer, just as the CO walked around the corner LOL.

They know exactly what time of year it is.  I have 2 flocks that come to my bird feeders every day now.  They show up every year once the snow crusts in February and usually stick around till I clean up from making maple syrup.  This year there are around 35 hens and young ones in one flock and 8 toms and jakes in another.  And 2 real nice toms.....
I have seen a small herd for the last 3 yrs around March, at Pearson by Dixie and Midway. You can see them at Dixie and 401 as well.
I see the same group in the field north of the 407 after the islington overpass and train bridge at all times of the day!
